intro: Tetraria fourcadei, commonly known as the Fourcade's tetraria, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its unique, compact growth form and specialized reproductive structures. The plant exhibits a peculiar morphology, with short, stiff leaves and a basal rosette structure. It is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, Tetraria fourcadei is of particular interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and conservation.
